org.grails.plugin.vaadin.ui
[Groovy] Class GspLayout

java.lang.Object
  com.vaadin.ui.AbstractComponent
      com.vaadin.ui.AbstractComponentContainer
          com.vaadin.ui.AbstractLayout
              com.vaadin.ui.CustomLayout
                  org.grails.plugin.vaadin.ui.GspLayout

class GspLayout
extends com.vaadin.ui.CustomLayout

A Vaadin CustomLayout that uses a Grails GSP file as the template.

This is distinct from Vaadin's custom layout, which typically requires the template to be a static HTML file.

This class facilitates mixing normal Grails tags such as <g:message> with Vaadin tags such as <v:label> in the same GSP. The aim is that you get the best of both worlds.

The GSP file can be a view, template or resource. See GspResourceLocator

Note that this class uses a 'mock' HttpRequest/HttpResponse when rendering the GSP. Currently, this implementation does not support Sitemesh layouts in GSPs. However, a GSP can use another GSP as a template by utilising the <v:layout> tag instead.

Authors:
Francis McKenzie

Nested Class Summary
protected class GspLayout.GspLayoutNode

A special GspComponentNode that keeps a collection of any Vaadin Components that are added to it, and returns an HTML snippet of the form <div location='component_0' /> to the child component, which should then add this snippet to the page's body text.

Constructor Detail

GspLayout

GspLayout(com.vaadin.Application application, java.lang.String gsp, java.util.Map params = null, java.util.Map model = null, java.util.Map flash = null, java.lang.String controllerName = null, boolean root = false)
Creates a new GspLayout with the specified GSP as the root view.
Parameters:
application - Current vaadin application - required because we render immediately, not when attached.
gsp - The uri of the GSP view, template or resource.
params - The params map to use when rendering the GSP.
model - The model map to use when rendering the GSP.
flash - The flash scope object to use when rendering the GSP.
controllerName - The controller name to use when rendering the GSP.
root - True if this is the root Gsp of the page (defaults to false)

GspLayout

GspLayout(com.vaadin.Application application, groovy.lang.Closure body, boolean root = false)
Creates a new GspLayout with the specified tag body.

Note this is primarily used by tag libraries.

Parameters:
application - Current vaadin application - required because we render immediately, not when attached.
body - The tag's body closure
root - True if this is the root Gsp of the page (defaults to false)

GspLayout

GspLayout(com.vaadin.Application application, java.lang.String gsp, groovy.lang.Closure body, java.util.Map params = null, java.util.Map model = null, java.util.Map flash = null, java.lang.String controllerName = null)
Creates a new GspLayout using the specified gsp layout template, and then applies the specified tag body to this template.

Note this is primarily used by tag libraries.

Parameters:
application - Current vaadin application - required because we render immediately, not when attached.
gsp - The URI of the GSP layout to use as a template
body - The tag's body closure
params - The params map to use when rendering the layout.
model - The model map to use when rendering the layout.
flash - The flash scope object to use when rendering the layout.
controllerName - The controller name to use when rendering the GSP.

GspLayout

GspLayout(com.vaadin.Application application, GspLayout other, java.lang.String gsp)
Creates a new GspLayout from the existing one, but using the specified Gsp template in place of the existing one's template.
Parameters:
application - Current vaadin application - required because we render immediately, not when attached.
other - The existing GspLayout to use.
gsp - The uri of the GSP view, template or resource to use

GspLayout

protected GspLayout(com.vaadin.Application application, java.lang.String gsp, groovy.lang.Closure body, java.util.Map params, java.util.Map model, java.util.Map flash, java.lang.String controllerName, boolean root, java.lang.String text, java.util.Map components)
Common constructor called by other constructors.
Parameters:
application - Current vaadin application - required because we render immediately, not when attached.
gsp - The URI of the GSP layout to use as a template
body - The tag's body closure
params - The params map to use when rendering the layout.
model - The model map to use when rendering the layout.
flash - The flash scope object to use when rendering the layout.
controllerName - The controller name to use when rendering the GSP.
root - True if this is the root Gsp of the page
text - The initial text to use for template contents
components - The initial set of components to use for template

 
Method Detail

evaluateGspContent

protected java.lang.CharSequence evaluateGspContent(groovy.lang.Closure body, java.util.Map components)
Executes the body closure (could be a tag body) and returns the resulting text.

Importantly, any Vaadin Components generated from executing the body closure are added to the specified Components map, stored by location name.

Parameters:
body - The closure to execute to obtain the GSP text and components
components - The map to use to collect any components resulting from evaluating the body

getVaadinApplication

com.vaadin.Application getVaadinApplication()
If this component is attached, gets the Vaadin Application of the parent, else gets the Vaadin Application from this class's vaadinApplication field.

removeBodyComponents

protected java.util.Map removeBodyComponents()
Removes the body components from this layout, because they're needed for another layout

render

protected void render(java.lang.String gsp, groovy.lang.Closure body, java.util.Map params, java.util.Map model, java.util.Map flash, java.lang.String controllerName)
Renders the layout using the Gsp and/or tag body.

renderBody

protected void renderBody(groovy.lang.Closure body)
Initialises the superclass CustomLayout using the specified tag body as the template.

Any Vaadin Components in the tag body are automatically added to this CustomLayout, in the order in which they appear.

Parameters:
body - The closure to execute to obtain the GSP text (could be a tag body)

renderGsp

protected void renderGsp(java.lang.String gsp, java.util.Map params, java.util.Map model, java.util.Map flash, java.lang.String controllerName)
Initialises the superclass CustomLayout using the specified GSP as the template.

The GSP is retrieved using a GspResourceLocator, and rendered using a GspResourcePageRenderer.

Any Vaadin Components in the GSP are automatically added to this CustomLayout, in the order in which they appear.

toString

java.lang.String toString()
This component as a String - mainly useful for logging purposes.
